Course_Name: [SoSe 2024] Stochastic models in neuroscience / Current topics in computational neuroscience (Seminar)

Discussions.Discussion_Name: date of seminar presentations and topic assignments

Messages.Author: Tilo Schwalger
Messages.Content: Dear participants of the seminar, thank you for choosing a date and a topic for the seminar presentations. The date will be  Thursday July 25, 2024 The location and starting time will be announced later. According to your choices, I made the following suggestion. Please let me know if you wish any changes! Name Topic Janik Faust Introduction Stochastic processes Haoyang Luo Fluctuation limits for mean-field interacting nonlinear Hawkes processes Florian Werner From micro to macro, part 1 Yuxin Xue Mesoscopic modeling of hidden spiking neurons Alfonso Yamamoto Rodriguez Quasi-renewal approximation  Please make an appointment with me (schwalger@math.tu-berlin.de) to discuss the content of your presentation.  Also, please send slides about one week before the seminar, so that I can still give feedback before your presentation.  Best, Tilo

Messages.Author: Tilo Schwalger
Messages.Content: Dear all, if you have not yet done so, please be reminded to choose a topic until tomorrow if you want to take part in the seminar and get credits. In case you need more time for choosing a topic, please let me know. According to the poll, the date of the seminar will likely be on July 25. Best regards, Tilo Schwalger

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Choosing the dates of the block seminar

Messages.Author: Tilo Schwalger
Messages.Content: Dear all, I have now opened the poll for the dates of the block seminar: https://isis.tu-berlin.de/mod/choice/view.php?id=1830814 I f you want to take part in it, please vote until next week May 15th. Choosing multiple dates is possible. Please, be reminded that you can choose topics until May 24. I have added a few papers and I noted the roughly the field: math: mathematical neuroscience comp neuro: computational neuroscience Please, let me know if you have any questions. Best regards, Tilo

Messages.Author: Tilo Schwalger
Messages.Content: Dear all, for the seminar "Stochastic models in neuroscience", there will be an initial organizational meeting tomorrow at 12:30pm in MAR 0.011.  We will mainly discuss the dates of the seminar presentations, which will take place in a block seminar at the end of the lecture period (presumably 2-3 days July). Best regards, Tilo Schwalger
